org.lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator

Class IndicatorLightSimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator.AbstractHardware<IndicatorLightSimulatorListener>
      • org.lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator.IndicatorLightSimulator

  • public class IndicatorLightSimulator
extends AbstractHardware<IndicatorLightSimulatorListener>
    A simple device that can be on or off as an indication to users. By default it is initially off. It ignores the enabled/disabled state.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IndicatorLightSimulator() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Turns the light on.
      void deactivate()
      Turns the light off.
      boolean isActive()
      Returns whether the light is currently on (active).
      void loadWithoutEvents(boolean active)
      Permits the initial state of the light to be on (when active is true) or off (when active is false) without causing events to be generated.

      • Methods inherited from class org.lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator.AbstractHardware

        deregister, deregisterAll, disable, enable, isDisabled, register, setDisabledWithoutEvents

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndicatorLightSimulator

        public IndicatorLightSimulator()

    • Method Detail

      • loadWithoutEvents

        public void loadWithoutEvents(boolean active)
        Permits the initial state of the light to be on (when active is true) or off (when active is false) without causing events to be generated.

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Turns the light on. Announces an "activated" event to its listeners.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Turns the light off. Announces a "deactivated" event to its listeners.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns whether the light is currently on (active). Causes no events.
